result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Anne Renc

2:40 PM Defendant Virginia A Neufeld appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Virginia A Neufeld.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs the parties that he had been the District Attorney at the time of the filing and makes additional statements.
Court does indicate that it can be fair and impartial.
Atty Renc would ask that the court recuse himself from this hearing.
Court will recuse himself for the hearing.
Atty Renc indicates that her client is serving a sentence after her probation was revoked.

BY THE COURT: 
Bond is continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Virginia Anne Neufeld appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer and Battery or Threats to an Officer of Law Enforcement. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.

Court will set the $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant may be on a PO hold.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.
